story.title: Urban Dreams, Rural Roots
story.content: In Nairobi's Kibera slum, 16-year-old Grace walks 2 hours daily to reach her KEF-supported school. Despite living in one of Africa's largest slums, she maintains top grades and dreams of becoming a lawyer to fight for social justice.
story.impact: KEF scholarship covers her school fees, uniform, and provides a safe space to study after school.

story.title: Breaking Barriers by the Lake
story.content: Along Lake Victoria's shores, 17-year-old Peter balances fishing with his family and excelling in chemistry. KEF's support means he doesn't have to choose between helping his family survive and pursuing his education.
story.impact: Flexible scheduling and financial support allow Peter to contribute to family income while staying in school.

story.title: Education in the Desert
story.content: In Kenya's arid north, 15-year-old Akiru is the first girl in her family to attend secondary school. KEF's boarding support protects her from early marriage while she pursues her passion for environmental science.
story.impact: Boarding school provides safety and stability, while mentorship helps her navigate cultural expectations.

story.title: Coastal Aspirations
story.content: In Mombasa's Old Town, 16-year-old Amina combines her love for marine biology with her Islamic faith. KEF's inclusive approach respects her cultural identity while opening doors to scientific careers.
story.impact: Culturally sensitive support and marine science resources fuel her passion for ocean conservation.

story.title: Running Towards Tomorrow
story.content: In the highlands of Eldoret, 17-year-old David trains as a runner while excelling in mathematics. KEF ensures that academic excellence matches his athletic achievements, preparing him for engineering studies.
story.impact: Balanced support for both academics and athletics, with tutoring to maintain high grades during training.
